thread.title: Report: Nokia 3310 and Nokia 6 launching in India in May
thread.title_full: Report: Nokia 3310 and Nokia 6 launching in India in May

title: Report: Nokia 3310 and Nokia 6 launching in India in May
text:
“The new Nokia 3310 will sport a brand new design and cost around Rs 3,000” Image credit – Concept Creator 
HMD Global, the new home for Nokia devices, is expected to launch the modern version of the iconic Nokia 3310 feature phone later this month at MWC in Barcelona. Now The Indian Express reports that the Nokia 3310 reboot will be making its way to India in May this year. Apart from the Nokia 3310, the brand will also be launching to Nokia 6 in the country, which was unveiled in China recently. 
The publication reports that its source in the dealership space in Delhi claims to have seen the new Nokia 3310 ahead of unveiling. The phone will reportedly be different than the original and will feature an oval shaped design and come in a range of hues. The report suggests that the new Nokia 3310 will available only in limited quantities, as HMD Global isn’t chasing the volume game with it. As per the report, HMD Global will be launching all upcoming Nokia-branded phones in India both online and offline. The brand has already started hiring in-shop demonstrators ahead of the launch of the Nokia 3310 and Nokia 6 in the country. Citing the independent mobile retailer Mahesh Telecom, the report suggests that consumers are waiting for the Nokia brand to re-enter the country, and have already started to inquire about the new Nokia 3310. 
The Nokia 3310 refresh is expected to be priced at around Rs 3,000 in India. The Nokia 6, on the other hand, will retail for around Rs 19,000. We will be on the floor at MWC to bring you all the details from Barcelona.
